body:
It seems like this part

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c881bc537eac722c0c61aba3fe15f3f4c9e3c138/src/nvim/api/win_config.c#L280-L286

should have some sort of check to prevent re-setting the window size to the default value when no size was passed

issue.title: Neogit vsplit is partially hidden

repository.name: neogit
repository.description: An interactive and powerful Git interface for Neovim, inspired by Magit

issue.body: ### Description Previously, when the panel was opened in vsplit, it was big and fully visible. Now it's mostly hidden. ### Neovim version NVIM v0.12.0-dev+1379-a4006360f Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1748459687 ### Operating system and version Fedora 42 ### Steps to reproduce 1. `nvim -nu minimal.lua` (provided `minimal.lua` errored out for me, see the one I used below) 2. `:Neogit` ### Expected behavior The panel should be fully visible ### Actual behavior ### Minimal config ```Lua vim.pack.add({ "https://github.com/NeogitOrg/neogit", "https://github.com/nvim-lua/plenary.nvim", }) require("neogit").setup({ kind="vsplit" }) ```

body: Oops! I'm surprised none of the tests caught that üôà

issue.title: fix(api): nvim_open_win default to half-size for splits

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Problem: after #35601, `nvim_open_win` incorrectly attempts to set the size of a split window to 0 if it wasn't specified.

Solution: only attempt to set the size again if it was actually specified. This has the effect of defaulting to half the size of the parent window (or it may be equalized with other windows to make room), like before.

Fix #36080

issue.title: [BUG] Errors displaying response: ...m/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/float.lua:151: 'width' key must be a positive Integer

repository.name: kulala.nvim
repository.description: A fully-featured ü§è HTTP-client üêº interface üñ•Ô∏è for Neovim ‚ù§Ô∏è.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

```lua
require("kulala").setup({})
```

This happens with Neovim nightly (NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1396+g645206e87f) while trying to open the news popup.

**Check health**
- ‚ùå ERROR {gRPCurl} not found
- ‚ùå ERROR {websocat} not found

**Submit the error stacktrace**

```lua
Errors displaying response: ...m/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/float.lua:151: 'width' key must be a positive Integer
stack traceback:
	[C]: in function 'nvim_open_win'
	...m/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/float.lua:151: in function 'create_window_footer'
	...im/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/init.lua:409: in function 'show_news_footer'
	...im/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/init.lua:206: in function 'show'
	...im/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/init.lua:282: in function 'open_view'
	...im/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/init.lua:443: in function <...im/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/init.lua:442>
	[C]: in function 'xpcall'
	...im/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/init.lua:442: in function 'open_default_view'
	...im/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/ui/init.lua:475: in function 'callback'
	...m/site/pack/site/opt/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/cmd/init.lua:308: in function ''
	vim/_editor.lua: in function <vim/_editor.lua:0>
```

**To Reproduce**
Simply `require("kulala").run()` on a `.http` file.

**Expected behavior**
Popup opens without errors.
